A single-walled stainless steel canteen for carrying and boiling water. Military flasks are intended for storing small amounts of water. First, the water is boiled at a very high temperature for purification and disinfection. Afterwards, it is cooled, to which it owes its refreshing "spark." The end result is water that is completely radiation-free. If in spite of the above, you still have doubts concerning its purity, you can always use akvatab. Due to the cost of production, military flasks are in a limited supply and are sold at a moderate price. Medics also have them in stock, but they're slightly more expensive as they include the cost of transportation.
